name: Euclidean Patterns
description: This algorithm generates rhythmic patterns of output pulses known as Euclidean patterns. For a detailed description of these patterns and how they are commonly found in music around the world see e.g. here or here. A pattern is described by the total number of steps and the number of pulses (i.e., the number of steps on which a pulse is output). The patterns can also be rotated. At zero rotation, the first step in the pattern will always be a pulse, and the remaining pulses distributed according to the algorithm. The rotation setting moves the first pulse later by a number of steps.
gui_description: The display shows a graphical representation of the patterns (channel 1 at the top).

parameters.name: Divisor
parameters.description: Sets the clock divisor when following MIDI clock.

parameters.name: Auto reset
parameters.description: Sets a number of quarter notes after which the pattern will automatically reset to step 1 (only available when following MIDI clock).

parameters.name: Steps
parameters.description: The number of steps in the pattern.

parameters.name: Pulses
parameters.description: The number of pulses in the pattern.

parameters.name: Repeat
parameters.description: The overall repeat count, i.e., the number of clocks until the pattern repeats. If this is zero, the number of steps is used as the repeat. If the repeat count is greater than the number of steps, the pattern is extended with silence.

parameters.name: Output type
parameters.description: Sets whether the output is a fixed length trigger or a clock pulse related to the period of the input clocks.

parameters.name: Length (ms)
parameters.description: Sets the trigger length, if the ‘Output type’ is ‘Trigger’.

parameters.name: Length (% of clock)
parameters.description: Sets the output clock pulse width, if the ‘Output type’ is ‘% of clock’.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

parameters.name: Output bus
parameters.description: The output bus for the channel.

parameters.name: ES-5 Expander
parameters.description: If set, the ES-5 expander header to use for output instead of the bus specified by the Output parameter. '1' means the ES-5 itself.

parameters.name: MIDI channel
parameters.description: The MIDI channel on which to send a note when a pulse fires.

parameters.name: MIDI note
parameters.description: The MIDI note number to send.

input_ports.name: Clock input
input_ports.description: A rising edge advances the patterns by one step.

input_ports.name: Reset input
input_ports.description: A high level resets the patterns to step 1 (and holds them there).

input_ports.name: Clock input
input_ports.description: The clock input bus. A rising edge advances the patterns by one step.

input_ports.name: Reset input
input_ports.description: The reset input bus. A high level resets the patterns to step 1 (and holds them there).

output_ports.name: Output bus
output_ports.description: The output bus for each channel, sending generated Euclidean rhythm pulses.

output_ports.name: ES-5 expander outputs
output_ports.description: If enabled via ES-5 Expander parameter, sends generated pulses to one of the 8 expander outputs (1-8).

output_ports.name: ES-5 Output
output_ports.description: If using an ES-5 expander output, sets which of the 8 outputs on the expander to use.
